1.verse: Greetings from Paul, a prisoner for Jesus Christ, and from Timothy, our brother. To Philemon, our dear friend and worker with us.

2.verse: Also to our sister Apphia, to Archippus, who serves with us in the Lord’s army, and to the church that meets in your home.

3.verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I remember you in my prayers. And I always thank my God for you.

5.verse: I thank God because I hear about the love you have for all of God’s holy people and the faith you have in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that the faith you share will make you understand every blessing we have in Christ.

7.verse: My brother, you have shown love to God’s people, and your help has greatly encouraged them. What a great joy and encouragement that has been to me.

8.verse: Accept Onesimus as a Brother - There is something that you should do. And because of the authority I have in Christ, I feel free to command you to do it.

9.verse: But I am not commanding you; I am asking you to do it out of love. I, Paul, am an old man now, and I am a prisoner for Christ Jesus.

10.verse: I am asking you for my son Onesimus. He became my son while I was in prison.

11.verse: In the past he was useless to you. But now he has become useful for both you and me.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you, but it’s as hard as losing part of myself.

13.verse: I would like to keep him here to help me while I am still in prison for telling the Good News. By helping me here, he would be representing you.

14.verse: But I did not want to do anything without asking you first. Then whatever you do for me will be what you want to do, not what I forced you to do.

15.verse: Onesimus was separated from you for a short time. Maybe that happened so that you could have him back forever,

16.verse: not to be just a slave, but better than a slave, to be a dear brother. That’s what he is to me. And I know he will mean even more to you, both as your slave and as one who shares your faith in the Lord.

17.verse: If you accept me as your friend, then accept Onesimus back. Welcome him like you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has done any wrong to you or owes you anything, charge that to me.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this in my own handwriting: I will pay back anything Onesimus owes. And I will say nothing about what you owe me for your own life.

20.verse: So, my brother, as a follower of the Lord please do this favor for me. It would be such a great encouragement to me as your brother in Christ.

21.verse: I write this letter knowing that you will do what I ask, and even more than I ask.

22.verse: Also, please prepare a room for me. I hope that God will answer your prayers and that I will be able to come and see you.

23.verse: Final Greetings - Epaphras is a prisoner with me for Christ Jesus. He sends you his greetings.

24.verse: Also Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke send their greetings. They are workers together with me.

25.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
